WorkItem.Description:
How to reproduce.
1) Load a Retribution character. (You can load Xyrm on Bonechewer if you need one to test).
2) Look at [Libram of Valiance] in ranged slot.
3) Change item to have a much shorter ICD (like 20 sec)
4) Increase fight duration by any amount in options panel.
5) Change ICD back to the correct 45 sec.
6) Increase fight duration again.
Â 
So the first and last duration would remember the proc rate of it at a 45sec ICD. But the middle duration will use the 20sec ICD proc rate, even if the current item has a 45sec ICD.
WorkItem.Summary: SpecialEffects: Uses same cached proc rate regardless of ICD of a proc

Comments.Message: I'm not sure if someone changed this, but it used to be that when you edit a special effect it actually creates a new object. It shouldn't remember the old settings. Just changing the value when the interpolation data is already cached won't update the cached values.
I'll redo the GUI code to create a new special effect.
